title: Lecture on Panihati festival | Sri Chanchalapathi Dasa | 20.06.2024
speaker: HG Chanchalapathi Dasa

segments.key_quote: So today we are observing a very unique festival, unique to our Gaudiya Sampradaya.
segments.summary: Introduction to the Paanihati festival, also known as Danda Mahotsav, observed by followers of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
segments.transcript: So today we are observing a very unique festival, unique to our Gaudiya Sampradaya. Followers of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu observe this festival. This festival is known as Paani Hati Festival because originally it happened in a small village called Paani Hati. This festival is also called Danda Mahotsav. Danda means a punishment, a festival of punishment.

segments.key_quote: I am not revealed to everyone. There is a curtain of Yogamaya that is covering me.
segments.summary: Discussion of how Krishna is not revealed to everyone due to Yogamaya and the living entities' desire for independence from the Lord.
segments.transcript: Contradictory. How can the festival which is joyous be a punishment? How can punishment which is miserable be a festival? So we will see all of that in a short while. Also, this festival conveys a very profound spiritual message. Krishna says, नाहं प्रकाश सर्वस्या योगमाय समावृतः, "I am not revealed to everyone. There is a curtain of Yogamaya that is covering me." So Krishna, who is the supreme personality of God, who is the Param Sathya, who is the Param Tattva, and in this material world, all the living entities are in a spirit of independence from the Lord, don't want to surrender to the Lord, want to lead a life independent of the Lord. To them, the Lord is not revealed easily.

segments.key_quote: Our position in this material world is Krishna Baheermukha Jeeva.
segments.summary: Explanation of the term Krishna Baheermukha Jeeva, describing the living entities turned away from Krishna, and the unnaturalness of this situation using the analogy of sunshine and the sun.
segments.transcript: Krishna Baheermukha Jeeva. Our position in this material world is Krishna Baheermukha Jeeva. We are Jeeva, but we are Baheermukha, turned away from Krishna. But this is not a natural situation, just like the sunshine cannot hope to be independent of the sun.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the original person and Balaram is his immediate expansion and he is prakasha tattva.
segments.summary: Explanation of how Balaram, as the Prakasha Tattva, reveals Krishna, and how the guru is a representation of Balaram, giving Krishna to the forgetful living entities; Balaram is Nithyananda Prabhu.
segments.transcript: So the living entities who are here in the material world, who have turned away from Krishna, how will they ever be rectified from their illusory, imagined position of being independent of the Lord? So Lord has one immediate expansion tattva called prakasha tattva. The Lord's prakasha tattva's function is to prakasha, to make, to illuminate, to reveal the truth to the living entities, to the living entities who are in ignorance. We are in such an ignorance, just like the sunshine thinking, "I will be independent of the sun," most ridiculous, most impossible. That is our situation. To such ignorant living entities, to bring prakasha, to illuminate them, there is an expansion of the Lord, and that expansion of the Lord is Balaram. So Krishna is the original person, and Balaram is his immediate expansion, and he is prakasha tattva. Krishna is para tattva or bhagavat tattva, non-different. Krishna and Balaram, Krishna and Balaram, both are on the same spiritual absolute position, but Balaram is the one who reveals Krishna, and one who reveals to the living entities about all this is guru, and that guru is actually a representation of Balaram prakasha tattva. This is the understanding. The guru is someone who reveals Krishna. Guru is someone who gives Krishna to the forgetful living entities. So when Krishna came as Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, Balaram, the prakasha tattva of the Lord, came as

segments.summary: Nithyananda Prabhu's role in revealing Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and preaching Krishna consciousness, even to people like Jagai and Madai, and how we can please Nithyananda Prabhu by preaching Krishna consciousness.
segments.transcript: Nithyananda Prabhu. Just as guru reveals Krishna, Balaram reveals Krishna, Nithyananda Prabhu reveals Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. One of the important leelas of Nithyananda Prabhu in Navadvip, he shows how to understand Krishna, how to please Krishna. And one of the important leelas of Nithyananda Prabhu was to go around and preach to the town folks of Navadvip and all kinds of people, including Jagai and Madai. He wanted to give Krishna, he wanted to give Chaitanya Mahaprabhu to everyone. That is the way even we can please Nithyananda Prabhu

segments.key_quote: He did not have any interest in the material activities, he wanted to be with Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
segments.summary: The story of Raghunath Das Goswami's early life, his detachment from material possessions, and his strong desire to be with Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, which his family opposed.
segments.transcript: by preaching Krishna consciousness. Now, in Chaitanya Leela, there is the great devotee Raghunath Das Goswami. Before he became a Goswami, before he came to that state, he was born into a very rich family in a place called Saptagram, and from a very young age, he had the great opportunity to see Chaitanya Mahaprabhu when he had just taken sanyas. When Chaitanya Mahaprabhu had taken sanyas, and he had a strong desire to come to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, and he was making an attempt to come to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, but his family members, father, mother, would not allow him. They thought that, no, our son, because they came from a rich family, they thought their son, our son, should be like us. He should inherit all our property. He should inherit the position that we have, and he should be a normal worldly person. But he did not have any interest in the material activities. He wanted to be with Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, serve the mission of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. And so he would try to run away from home as a young boy, young man, and his father would send his guards and bring him back. So this happened many, many times, and every time Raghunath Das's father would bring him back. So Raghunath was very unhappy. He was longing to be with Chaitanya Mahaprabhu to serve his mission, be in his association.

segments.key_quote: Punishment from the lord is very from the master is very desirable because it's a form of mercy of the master.
segments.summary: Raghunath Das meets Nithyananda Prabhu in Panihati, and Nithyananda Prabhu 'punishes' him by asking him to feed all his associates with cheetah dahi, which Raghunath Das happily accepts.
segments.transcript: So around that time, near Saptagram, there is a small village, Panihatti. Nithyananda Prabhu had come with a lot of his associates. Nithyananda Prabhu would be travelling around in Bengal broadcasting Krishna consciousness on the order of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. So he came there, and he would do kirtans, he would tell about Krishna to people, and he had hundreds of associates with him, or thousands of associates with him. So Raghunath Das, when he heard that Nithyananda Prabhu has come to a neighboring village, he came to see him, and from a distance, out of humility, from a distance, he was offering his respects. But Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's associates, sorry, Nithyananda Prabhu's associates pointed out, "Raghunath Das is there far away." So Nithyananda Prabhu wanted to bring him, so they sent message and Raghunath Das was brought. Nithyananda Prabhu was also, he had a sense of a very unique sense of humor, and so when Raghunath Das was brought close to him, Nithyananda Prabhu said, "Raghunath, you are trying to hide from me," and Raghunath said, "No, no, Prabhu, not at all." And then he said, "I want to punish you today." Raghunath Das was very happy. Nithyananda Prabhu is going to punish me. So punishment from the Lord is very, from the master is very desirable because it's a form of mercy of the master. So Nithyananda Prabhu said, "The punishment is, I know you are coming from a very rich family, you feed all my associates, and I have a special request, you should make cheetah dahi, flat rice mixed with yogurt, flat rice mixed with condensed milk, and two parts like this, you should distribute to everybody." So Raghunath Das was very happy

segments.key_quote: We belong to the cowherd clan and coming on a picnic like this on the bank of a river and having delicious food to eat is something that we love.
segments.summary: Raghunath Das organizes the Chiradahi festival, serving Nithyananda Prabhu and his associates on the banks of the Ganga, reminiscent of Krishna and Balaram's Vanabhoj pastimes; Chaitanya Mahaprabhu appears mystically.
segments.transcript: to accept this punishment. He had all the resources, so he brought all his assistants from his home and got, purchased a lot of cheetah dahi, mixed mangoes to it, mixed bananas to it. Chaitanya Charitamruta says he mixed bananas and honey to all of this and served Nithyananda Prabhu and all the associates on the banks of Ganga. And at that time, Nithyananda Prabhu made a statement, "We belong to the cowherd clan, and coming on a picnic like this on the bank of a river and having delicious food to eat is something that we love." Actually, this statement is significant because Nithyananda Prabhu is Balarama, and Krishna and Balarama and the cowherd boys would go on the banks of Yamuna and they would have their picnic everyday. All the things that their mothers had brought, had sent with them, they would share, called Vanabhoj. So that's what Nithyananda Prabhu was reminiscing. And at that time, Nithyananda Prabhu by his meditation brought Chaitanya Mahaprabhu there, and only a few fortunate souls, it is said, could see Chaitanya and Nithyananda, and there was ecstatic uproarious kirtan with Chaitanya and Nithyananda and chanting of the holy names which filled the air, and this Chiradahi which was given to Nithyananda and Chaitanya Mahaprabhu was served to everyone. So this was a festival, and then towards the end of the festival, mystically Chaitanya Mahaprabhu vanished from the scene and only Nithyananda Prabhu and other associates were there.

segments.key_quote: If we have to attain the lotus feet of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu service to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu we should get the blessings of Nithyananda Prabhu who is the Prakasha Tattva.
segments.summary: Nithyananda Prabhu blesses Raghunath Das, freeing him from obstacles, and the importance of receiving the mercy of Nithyananda Prabhu to attain Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, mirroring the relationship between Balaram and Krishna.
segments.transcript: And the next day, Nithyananda Prabhu was moving away from there to another place, and Raghunath Das once again came and requested him that, "My situation is, I am not able to, my parents are holding me back. I want to be serving Chaitanya Mahaprabhu." And now at that time, Nithyananda Prabhu placed his lotus feet on the head of Raghunath Das who was lying fallen down at his feet, and then Nithyananda Prabhu said, "Very soon you will be freed from all the obstacles," and exactly like that, in a few next few days or weeks, Raghunath Das was able to go and be with Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. So if we have to attain the lotus feet of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, service to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, we should get the blessings of Nithyananda Prabhu who is the Prakasha Tattva. So Raghunath Das received the mercy of Nithyananda Prabhu. To receive the mercy of Nithyananda Prabhu, we have to please him. Raghunath Das pleased Nithyananda Prabhu by fulfilling his request to have a big festival of Chitadahi. So this is the principle that we need the mercy of Nithyananda Prabhu to get Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. We need the mercy of Balaram to attain Krishna's lotus feet and Krishna's service.

segments.key_quote: If we get the mercy of Nithyananda Prabhu all our samsaravasana all our material desires which keeps us in this material world will go away.
segments.summary: Offering of Chiradahi to Chaitanya and Nithyananda Prabhu, praying for Nithyananda Prabhu's mercy to remove material desires, and glorifying Srila Prabhupada for revealing these truths.
segments.transcript: And hence this festival commemorates this important spiritual principle. And so in our temple here on the banks of Kalyani, we offer Chitadahi to Chaitanya and Nithyananda Prabhu, and they will go around in a nauka vihar, and all of us will also receive the prasadam of Chitadahi remembering this past time. Let us pray to Nithyananda Prabhu, by Nithyananda Prabhu's mercy, aarkabe nithai chander karunahave samsaravasana morekabe tuchahave. If we get the mercy of Nithyananda Prabhu, all our samsaravasana, all our material desires which keeps us in this material world will go away. So this is a special festival where we pray to Nithyananda Prabhu to shower his mercy so that all our material desires will go away and we become qualified to go back to the spiritual world. With these few reflections, we will next proceed to the next part of the festival. Shri Nithyananda Prabhu ki jaya! Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu ki jaya! Shri Raghunath Das Goswami ki jaya! Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu ki jaya! Shri Raghunath Das Goswami ki jaya! Srila Prabhupada who revealed all these things to us, Srila Prabhupada ki jaya!
